etymons.notes: Arb. prpt or frft/ṭ ‘zarpeln, flattern, sich hin und herwerfen’ VW I 59, VW II 94

Preterit.turoyo: Naqqa i qaṭәn xila naqqa mfarfṭo ‘ 004_NE_Ditin_Hezar; 12:23
translations: As soon as the cat ate, then she

Infectum.turoyo: hama ḥzeli: gava kale ko-mifarfəṭ 775; 44/111; kul=lalyo (…) šəmʕi-wa qole d-ʕezo oṯe-wa qarén mina qaymi-wa əzzehən-wa ga ʕezo kal-ko-mifarfto
translations: I saw that [the cow] was panting
‘Every night (...) they heard the voice of a goat, the moan came from it, they stood up, went (and saw): the goat was in death-agony’ LuF 304/67;
